intro: Spatularia virginiensis, commonly known as the Virginia spatula, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly in wetland and marsh habitats. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spatula-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in swampy areas. Spatularia virginiensis plays a role in supporting local wildlife, including insects and birds, within its wetland ecosystem.
